original: Eklund, Karl (Kalle) Oskar, konstnär, Vadstena, f. 13/7/91 i Örebro av Ernst E. o. Karin Forsberg. G. 20 m. Maria Welin. Barn: Karl-Göran f. 21, Kajsa 22, Ulla 29. — Stud. v. Althins målarsk. o. v. konstakad. i Sthlm. Stud:res. t. Danm., Tyskl, HolL, Belg., Frankr. o. Ital. Debut, i Sthlm 17. Repr. i Nat :mus., Örebro 1., Norrköp. o. Linköp. mus.
translated: Eklund, Karl (Kalle) Oskar, artist, Vadstena, born July 13, 1891 in Örebro to Ernst E. and Karin Forsberg. Married in 1920 to Maria Welin. Children: Karl-Göran, born 1921, Kajsa, born 1922, and Ulla, born 1929. Karl studied at Althin's School of Painting and at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Stockholm. He traveled to Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, France and Italy for study purposes. He debuted in Stockholm in 1917 and his work is represented in the National Museum, Örebro Museum, Norrköping Museum and Linköping Museum.

structured.name: Karl (Kalle) Oskar Eklund

alumniOf.name: Royal Academy of Fine Arts, Stockholm

structured.description: Karl (Kalle) Oskar Eklund was a Swedish artist born on July 13, 1891 in Örebro to Ernst E. and Karin Forsberg. He debuted in Stockholm in 1917 and his work is represented in the National Museum, Örebro Museum, Norrköping Museum and Linköping Museum. Karl was married to Maria Welin in 1920, and they had three children together: Karl-Göran, Kajsa and Ulla. Karl studied at Althin's School of Painting and the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Stockholm. He also traveled to Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, and Italy for study purposes.
